subject: Re: [junit] Digest Number 1047
msgSnippet: ... One of the things I liked about JWebUnit was the ability to also test JavaScript (onload/onclick events).  That can give you a lot better functional
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>>I find that some folks prefer HtmlUnit while others prefer HttpUnit.
>>> At the end of the day they both do basically the same thing.
>>> Therefore, my advice would be to pick the tool you're most productive
>>> using.
>
>
> Agreed. I just want people to expose themselves to both. They may not be
> aware of the choice. That and jWebUnit.

One of the things I liked about JWebUnit was the ability to also test
JavaScript (onload/onclick events). That can give you a lot better
functional coverage if you app uses Javascript. I'm pretty sure
HTTPUnit doesn't offer this (JWebUnit is build on HTTPUnit, I believe).
Does HTMLUnit or any other free tool offer this?

-- Chad
